title: Solara Game Design Document
text:
Solara is a stylized open-globe action-adventure fantasy game with support for up to 64 simultaneous players and built from the ground up for physical immersion.
The world of Solara falls increasingly to darkness. The residents have abandoned their homes for shelter within the last standing city of Solara. The majority of the population has turned into mindless beasts. You awaken as a resident of Solara. Does the will of a hero or the will of beasts awaken with you?
Take on the world alone or form an adventurerâ€™s guild in a fantastical, yet-dangerous, quest to eradicate darkness and retake Solara. Explore the land to discover lost treasures, uncover knowledge, and unravel its mysteries. Master your trade or become a jack of all trades. You determine your path.



No Mans Sky, while it took some time, eventually demonstrated the incredible power of procedural generation. Their implementation has resulted in a mind-bending sci-fi exploration game that has captivated me for hundreds of hours.
Zelda: Breathe of the Wild is an illustrious open-world action adventure game with some basic RPG elements. The simple, yet compelling style and mechanics contributes to a world that breathes.
OG virtual reality rpg games like Zenith: The Last City, Karnage Chronicles, and Vengeful Rites that first immersed me in fantasy worlds.

title: Solara Game Design Document
text:
Gameplay
The world is filled with distinct characters and environments that drive fresh quest opportunities. Dungeons and encampments can be taken down for experience and looted for treasure. Mastering a trade will prove valuable in the ultimate quest to defeat the world boss and restore the worldâ€™s peace.

title: Solara Game Design Document
text:
Character
Characters are all humanoids that exist in the world, playable and non-playable. The following stats apply to both.

Character stats

Physical stats
A character has three physical stats:

Vitality - determines how much damage a character can take. A characterâ€™s base vitality stat is 100 life points.
Strength - determines how much damage a character can deal. A characterâ€™s base strength stat is 10 damage. This means that a fully effective blow will deal 10 points in damage to another characterâ€™s vitality or an itemâ€™s durability.
Speed - determines how quickly a character can move. A characterâ€™s base walking speed is INSERT WLK_SPD and base running speed is INSERT RUN_SPD.

These base values are adjusted slightly based on the character build 1. See TableÂ 1 for a generalized overview of this system based on character BMI 2. Physical stats can be further modified via items and consumables.


Standing
A characterâ€™s standing indicates their threat and morality to others. The two standing stats are:

Level - an evolving measure of a characterâ€™s accomplishments. It is derived from enemy encounter outcomes. A characterâ€™s default and minimum level is 1. The maximum level is 100.
Karma - an evolving measure of a characterâ€™s deeds. It is derived from your actions. The quests you take on, the enemies you kill, and even your environmental impact will dictate your place in this world. The default karma is NEUTRAL. Creating a world with karmic justice requires deep considerations for both the penalties and consequences. See SectionÂ 3.1 on Karmic Justice for more.

title: Solara Game Design Document
text:
Environment
A procedural system for the creation of unique and infinitely difficult worlds3. The globe is fully navigable with diverse landscapes, wildlife, and beasts.

Resources
All resources can be gathered the environment. The resource types are:

resources - various types and qualities of wood, ore, and fibers
ingredients - various types and qualities of meat, fish, vegetation, and herbs

Resources can be gathered and crafted into items by characters engaging in various professions.


Items
Items can be discovered throughout the world or crafted from resources gathered from the environment. The item types are:

wearables are crafted from resources by outfitters
consumables are crafted from ingredients by cooks and from resources by alchemists
tools are crafted from resources by toolmakers

Every item in Solara will fit into one of these types. Below is a visual representation of our item hierarchy.

title: Solara Game Design Document
text:
Economy

Professions
There are various professions in resources gathering and crafting.

Gathering professions
The following professions are dedicated to the gathering of natural resources and ingredients from the environment:

Hunter
Fisher
Forager
Miner
Logger



Crafting professions
The following professions are dedicated to crafting items from resources gathered from the environment:

Outfitter
Toolmaker
Cook
Barkeep
Alchemist




Trade
Resources and items can be traded between characters on the open market or privately. Historical sale prices are public record at the server level.
One currency, forever.

title: Solara Game Design Document
text:
Karmic Justice
A characterâ€™s karma can range from DARK to HERO. Characters can also have GOOD, BAD, and NEUTRAL karma. A characterâ€™s karma can be positively impacted through the completion of hero quests. More importantly, karma penalties are levied for various misdeeds and the consequences bad karma can be steep.

Karmic penalties

Character killing and looting
Dark quests
Resource overconsumption and waste



Karmic consequences

Loss of safe zone and housing
Beast deformation?
Increased drop rates
Bounties
